thread.title: Moped rider fighting for life after crash
thread.title_full: Moped rider fighting for life after crash

title: Moped rider fighting for life after crash
text:
Moped rider fighting for life after crash in Andover Moped rider fighting for life after crash 15 comments 
A MOPED rider is fighting for his life following a crash with a car this morning. 
At about 5.55am this morning a black Nissan Almera Tino was involved in a collision with a Black Peugeot moped in Weyhill Road, Andover. 
The driver of the moped, a man in his 60s, has been taken to North Hampshire Hospital at Basingstoke with life-threatening injuries. Share article 
A road closure is currently in place between the 100 Acre Roundabout and north to East Portway Road, whilst officers from the Roads Policing Unit conduct an investigation. 
If you saw this incident or have any information please contact Roads Policing Unit at Whitchurch on 101 quoting Operation Notebook. Moped rider fighting for life after crash in Andover   Polish Bugger 9:46am Fri 18 Sep 15 
I bet driver didn't see moped and moped didn't have it's light on. Typical I bet driver didn't see moped and moped didn't have it's light on. Typical Polish Bugger

Moped lights are ALWAYS on when the engine is running, infact, most recently bought motorcylces and scooters(what we call mopeds are not actually mopeds due to lack of pedals) are all built with this supposed safety feature of running lights that you can NOT turn off. Hope the man recovers, Mopeds had pedals up to 1977 , after then all mopeds were a class of motorcycle under 50cc and restricted to no more than 30 mph. Technically they're still not mopeds though since the name comes from the vehicle being motorised and having pedals, these bicycles you sometimes see with little strimmer engines fitted as a kit would be classed as mopeds. This scam has been operating around Oxford, particularly on the A34 at Botley, for months. Oxford residents are well aware of it so presumably the con man seeks pastures new. Variant of the dangerous scam in the Champs Elysees where the Korean scammer offers you a "500 euro" note to buy a €420 LV bag for him and his missus & keep the change, "because the shop has a one bag rule and we want two" Anyone encountered that one? You'd do time for forged currency in France, so beware! This scam has been operating around Oxford, particularly on the A34 at Botley, for months.
